title: How to Make a Chicken Caesar Sandwich

steps.headline: Pierce the raw chicken with a fork.
steps.description: Sprinkle some salt and pepper on it.

steps.headline: Put a dry frying pan on a medium heat.
steps.description: Add a thin layer of cooking oil to the pan and let it warm up.

steps.headline: Add the chicken to the pan.
steps.description: Fry it on a low heat until both sides have a nice golden color, and the chicken is cooked through. Set it aside.

steps.headline: Prepare the salad by first separating the lettuce leaves.
Mix the crème fraîche, Parmesan cheese, lemon juice and capers with 1 tbsp cold water.
Toast the bread and rub with the cut side of the garlic.
Crush the garlic and add to the dressing.
Slice the warm chicken breasts on the diagonal.
Top the toast with lettuce leaves, sliced chicken breast, and a drizzle of the Caesar dressing.
Finish with a few shavings of Parmesan.

text: Pierce the raw chicken with a fork. Sprinkle some salt and pepper on it. Put a dry frying pan on a medium heat. Add a thin layer of cooking oil to the pan and let it warm up. Add the chicken to the pan. Fry it on a low heat until both sides have a nice golden color, and the chicken is cooked through. Set it aside. Prepare the salad by first separating the lettuce leaves.  Mix the crème fraîche, Parmesan cheese, lemon juice and capers with 1 tbsp cold water. Then season to taste. Toast the bread and rub with the cut side of the garlic.  Crush the garlic and add to the dressing.  Slice the warm chicken breasts on the diagonal.  Top the toast with lettuce leaves, sliced chicken breast, and a drizzle of the Caesar dressing.  Finish with a few shavings of Parmesan.
